duties_responsibilities.duty: Provision, coordination, and assurance of comprehensive medical care using sound medical knowledge and pertinent standards of care.
Educate patients and families to facilitate healthy adjustment to new or changed health patterns.
Evaluate treatment and health care plans for effectiveness and modify per clinical standards and practice protocols.
Prescribe medical equipment, devices, physical and occupational therapy, and home health services per practice protocol.
Coordinate implementation of clinical research studies or clinical trials, including patient screening, enrollment, and data collection.
Monitor and trend the cost-effectiveness of the position, particularly as it relates to the efficiency and performance indicators established for the service.
Facilitate patient throughput and efficient process during patient admission and discharge.
Maintain PA board certification and annual CME requirement for re-appointment and privileging.
Promote own professional growth and development in clinical role.
Participate in designated activities related to professional physician assistant practice standards.
Demonstrate knowledge of the organization's Core Values and incorporate them into the performance of responsibilities.
Assist in the preparation, implementation, and evaluation of research protocols when applicable.
Provide consultation about the therapeutic regimen to the nursing staff responsible for the patient's care in the hospital setting.
Plan and organize care to meet individual patient needs and to ensure appropriate clinical resource utilization.
Participate in the development and revision of interdisciplinary and hospital standards, patient, and family education materials relevant to the area of practice and expertise.

Work collaboratively with the interdisciplinary team, including the attending physician, to develop and implement the therapeutic plan of care for a group of patients and ensure communication with family members.
Facilitate the continuity of care across the continuum of services, e.g., home care, other facilities, appointments with MDs, etc.

education_certification.credential: Current New York State Physician Assistant License
ACLS, PALS, NRP Provider (Neonatal Resuscitation Program) NALS per delineation of privileges.
Membership in pertinent professional organizations preferred.
